intro: Dyschoriste paraguariensis, commonly known as yareta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure with thick, fleshy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
